Internship Retreat Overview

The program offers a dynamic and immersive experience, placing a strong emphasis on client-to-client interaction, a fundamental cornerstone of Ayurvedic practice. Delving into the intricacies of Ayurveda, the retreat includes in-depth discussions on clients' conditions and procedures for effective treatment follow-up. Participants will engage in hands-on exploration of various diagnostic techniques, refining their diagnostic skills and fostering a deeper understanding of individualized patient care.

An integral aspect of the program is the systematic examination and knowledge enhancement pertaining to Ayurvedic principles. Participants will gain profound insights into system-wise examinations, further fortifying their foundation in Ayurvedic practices.

Beyond diagnostics, the program offers a holistic approach by imparting extensive knowledge about the utilization of various herbs in correcting Doshas and Agni, essential for the treatment correction process. Furthermore, engaging sessions on Dinacharya and Yoga are strategically designed to focus on therapeutic and rejuvenative practices, enriching

participants with practical tools for holistic health.. Enriching the learning experience, the program hosts invited talks from esteemed experts in the fields of panchakarma, providing invaluable insights into advanced Ayurvedic therapies. Additionally, a structured schedule unfolds to explore the nuances of Ayurvedic cooking, imparting an in-depth understanding of dietary principles, Pathy apathya, and Virudhaahara.

As part of the program's immersive approach, participants embark on enlightening visits to botanical and herbal gardens. These excursions not only offer a firsthand experience with diverse herbs but also provide opportunities for organoleptic examinations, elevating the learning experience beyond theory.

Tailored for aspiring Ayurvedic Health Counselors and Ayurvedic Practitioners, this preceptorship promises a transformative journey, blending theoretical knowledge with hands-on experiences to empower participants in their path toward becoming proficient Ayurvedic healthcare practitioners.

180 in-person hourss
54 Supervised Client Encounterss
Hands-On Clinical Experiences

Discover Ubud, Bali - A Haven for Ayurvedic Learning

Nestled amidst Bali's emerald rice fields and verdant rainforests, Ubud emerges as an enchanting haven for those embarking on an Ayurvedic journey. This town, steeped in Hindu culture, offers a serene and spiritually rich environment, ideal for deepening understanding of Ayurvedic principles. The daily practices and rituals rooted in this culture resonate deeply with the holistic wellness approach of Ayurveda, providing students with a unique, immersive learning experience.

In Ubud, the intersection of a thriving yoga community and the teacher's extensive network within Ayurvedic and yogic centers creates a dynamic educational atmosphere. This, coupled with Ubud's reputation as a sanctuary for yoga enthusiasts and plant-based foodies, enhances the overall experience. The town's vibrant vegetarian and vegan culinary scene, inspired by Ayurvedic dietetics, offers a plethora of nourishing and flavorful options, making it a paradise for those seeking a lifestyle aligned with Ayurvedic and yogic principles.

Accommodation & Ayurvedic Cuisine

Our Ayurvedic internship program in Ubud offers comprehensive room and board that perfectly complements your educational experience. Included in the tuition, each participant enjoys the comfort of a private room with an ensuite bathroom, ensuring a peaceful and personal space for relaxation and reflection. The accommodation, while basic, is designed to provide a serene and comfortable environment, conducive to both study and rest.

In addition to comfortable lodging, participants are treated to three daily Ayurvedic meals. These meals are thoughtfully prepared to align with Ayurvedic dietary principles, offering a variety of nutritious, balanced, and flavorful dishes. This culinary experience not only supports your physical well-being but also deepens your understanding of Ayurvedic nutrition and its practical application. This harmonious blend of restful accommodation and nourishing cuisine creates an ideal setting for both personal growth and professional development in Ayurvedic studies.

Your Tuition Covers

  • 180 In-Person Training Hours
  • Minimum of 54 Client Encounters, Adhering to AAC's Guidelines
  • Daily Yoga Sessions
  • Certificate of Completion
  • Official Transcripts
  • 28 Nights of Accommodation
  • All Meals (Ayurvedic Cuisine)

Frequently Asked Questions

  • Absolutely! Our internship is open to both practitioners and enthusiasts of Ayurveda, even if you're not currently enrolled in an AHC or AP program. We welcome individuals seeking to enhance their clinical skills in Ayurveda. However, a foundational understanding of Ayurvedic principles is essential for participation.

  • A basic knowledge of Ayurveda is the key prerequisite for our internship. We kickstart the program with a theoretical module to bring all participants up to speed. Additionally, our application process includes an interview to gauge your readiness for this immersive experience.

  • Aligned with AAC guidelines, participants will engage in at least 54 supervised Client Encounters, plus a minimum of 10 observational encounters. This ensures a comprehensive and practical learning experience.

  • While we don't offer scholarships for this program, we strive to make it accessible through flexible payment options. Extended payment plans are available upon request, but full payment must be completed prior to starting the internship.

  • A $500 non-refundable deposit secures your spot. Cancellations made 6 weeks prior to the start date are non-refundable. If you cancel before this period, you'll receive a refund excluding the deposit.

  • Accommodation location varies based on enrollment numbers. Regardless, you're assured a private room with an ensuite bathroom in Ubud is included in your tuition.

  • Definitely! The internship schedule allows free time every Sunday and evenings post-17:15. It's a great opportunity to explore Ubud and its surroundings, though do remember dinner at 19:00 is part of your tuition.

  • To get the most out of this experience, we recommend familiarizing yourself with 'Prakruti' by Dr. Vasant Lad, an insightful read on Ayurvedic principles.
